title: As a user I want to see files attached in ebis2 amateur in ebis2.5
custom_preconds:
GIVEN all international registration profiles were converted from ebis 2.0 to ebis 2.5 with attachments
AND BOC or Club user logs to ebis 2.5 with international registration profile permission
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to download the converted files from international registration profile
custom_expected: THEN files should be available for download in 2.5

title: As a user I do not want to wait for the Reports Widget to load in order to click the Blank Forms tab.
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with permission to access the System Forms Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on the Reports icon on the tab nav
custom_expected:
THEN system should load the Reports tab without the entire page being blocked by a spinner
AND doing a browser refresh while on the Blank Forms tab should not bring the user back to the Reports tab

title: As a user I want to Edit an existing International Amateur profile that has not yet been registered
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with the Unregistered profile creation LDAP
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an existing Unregistered profile
custom_expected:
THEN user should see an Edit button, regardless of if they have Registration permissions
AND if the user clicks "Edit", the form should reload in Edit mode, just as though the profile were being created as an Unregistered profile for the first time
AND the user should be able to Save changes to the profile with the system only checking the required fields for an Unregistered, scouting profile
AND iff the profile is Approved AND the user also has Registration permissions, they should see a "Register MLSB Entered" button on the profile
AND clicking "Register MLSB Entered" button should reload the form in edit mode
AND the user should be able to complete the registration of this player just as though they had started the profile from scratch
BUT if the profile is Approved and the user ONLY has Registration permissions, they should only see a "Register MLSB Entered" button on the profile (not edit)
AND clicking "Register MLSB Entered" button should reload the form in edit mode
AND the user should be able to complete the registration of this player just as though they had started the profile from scratch

title: As a Scout Admin I want to Reject a new International Amateur profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a scout admin user is logged in with permission to reject new International Amateur profile
AND scout admin user navigated to Admin clipboard 
AND scout admin user should see any player profile with a Submitted status on their Admin clipboard
AND scout admin opens the submitted profile from the Clipboard and it should open the item in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Reject" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will save any edits made to the profile. No required field or format checks are run. 
AND A blue notification will be thrown "Successfully Rejected"
AND The profile's status should be updated to "Rejected". 
AND The profile entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard.
AND The Scout's Clipboard entry should be updated to "Rejected". 
AND The profile should not appear in the Registration Admin widget. 

*Note that even MLSB Admins with BOC permissions should be able to complete this flow.*

title: As a scouting user I want to re-submit a new International Amateur profile for review
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to create a new International Amateur profile 
AND a scouting user navigated to their Scout Clipboard 
AND a scouting user opens international amateur profiles created by them in a Rejected status in edit mode with a "Save" "Cancel" and "Submit" button available.
AND a scout user should be able to edit the profile and save changes without a required field or formatting check.
AND saving the profile while in a Rejected status will revert the profile's status to "Preliminary".
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Submit" from a rejected profile
custom_expected:
THEN system should save any edits made, run a required field and format check and complete the submission, just as though the profile were in a Preliminary status.
AND A blue notification will be thrown "Successfully Submitted" 
AND The profile should have its status updated to Submitted, and appear on the Admin Clipboard and Scout Clipboard as Submitted.

title: As a scouting user I want to resubmit a new international workout report for review
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a scouting user logged in with permission to Submit new International Workout Reports 
AND a scout user navigated to their Scout Clipboard
AND a scout opens a Rejected report from the Clipboard in edit mode 
AND a scout should be able to edit the report and save changes without a required field or formatting check.
custom_steps: WHEN a scout user click "Submit" from a rejected report
custom_expected:
THEN the system should save any edits made, run a business rules, required field and format check and complete the submission, just as though the report were in a Preliminary status. 
AND A blue notification is thrown "Successfully Submitted"
AND The report should have its status updated to Submitted, and appear on the Admin Clipboard and Scout Clipboard as Submitted.

title: As a user I want to see International Suspects in Red in quick search
custom_preconds: GIVEN user logs in with International Amateur player permission
custom_steps: WHEN user is using International Amateur quick search to search for International Suspects
custom_expected: THEN International Suspects should appear in the results in red font.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to add a new trainer/agent to the system from a Club entered profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user logged in with create permissions for Registration profile and Trainer/Agent profile
AND user is in edit mode on a club registration profile as BOC user
AND user navigated to a "New Trainer/Agent" hyperlink in the Trainer/Agent section of the profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "New Trainer/Agent" link
custom_expected:
THEN the sytsem will open a new trainer/agent profile in a new tab/window with the information from the club entered trainer/agent section prepopulated in the profile.
AND Club users do not see this hyperlink.
AND The BOC user should have the ability to save the profile, just like they would from any other entry point.
AND Saving the profile should autopopulate the "BOC Profile" field with the newly entered trainer's information.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=create_new_trainer_agent_v1

title: As a Reg Admin I want to be able to merge International Suspect profiles
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND user navigated to Reg Admin widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigate to Reg Admin widget
custom_expected:
THEN International Suspects should now appear in the Reg Admin widget under the "Unregistered" filter, or if the filter is set to "All". 
AND Users with merge permissions should be able to merge International suspects just like they are able to merge International Prospects. 
AND Merging these profiles should carry over any associated Daily Reports, if applicable. 
AND International Suspects should appear in the merge confirmation message in red text.

title: As a scouting user I want to be able to edit the Scouting Info section of a Registration player
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scout and Scout admin logs with permission to create/edit unregistered player profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing an existing Registration profile
custom_expected:
THEN If the player already has scouting info, or if past the player's eligible to sign date, show the edit button, and allow them to edit only the scouting info
BUT If the player does not have any scouting info, HIDE the edit button, and show the "Add Scouting Info" in view mode only
AND Non-Scouting Users the Add Scouting Info button will display in view AND edit mode; a confirmation modal will display if the player is in edit mode ONLY.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Level 2 List Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user logs
custom_steps: WHEN user is in reporting widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Level 2 List" will appear on Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND The category of this report should be "International". 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
AND The report will continue to use the existing LDAP. 
AND The requirements used in-app should be reflected in the report.
AND Club users do not see Players Selected by another Org in the report.
BUT BOC users see all L2 Players, and they also have their own set of columns. 
BUT MLSB user and unaffiliated users should only see players Selected by the BOC.  

*Note for QA - This should basically replicate each Org's Level 2 Registration List widget in report form with some additional fields*

Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+List+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+List+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+List+-+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+List+-+Prompts

Report Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+List+-+Audience+-+Security-+Frequency

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Club Tracking List Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club or BOC user logs
custom_steps: WHEN user is in reporting widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Club Tracking List" report will appear on the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND The category of this report should be "International". 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
AND The report will continue to use the existing LDAP. 
AND The requirements used in-app should be reflected in the report.
BUT Club users do not see trainer/agent/league information on the report that was entered by another Org.
AND Club users do not see "Pre-Verified" as a registration status on the report itself or as a prompt. 

*Note for QA - This should basically replicate each Org's Club Registration List widget in report form with some additional fields*

Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Tracking+List+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Tracking+List+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Tracking+List+-+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Tracking+List+-+Prompts

Report Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Tracking+List+-+Audience+-+Security+-+Frequency

title: As a BOC user I want International Amateur advanced searches tracked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Advanced Search
AND user navigated to the International Amateur Advanced Search
custom_steps: WHEN user advanced search for any Intl Ama player
custom_expected:
THEN the system needs to keep a record of every international amateur advanced search undertaken. 
AND the system will need to keep a record of the following information about each search: 
 - Username of the user conducting the search
 - Org of the user conducting the search
 - Date of the search
 - Time of the search (EST)
 - The filters applied
 - The operators applied with each filter
 - The value entered for each filter
 - How many results were returned
AND Each time the user hits "Search" is considered a new and unique search.

title: As a Scout I want to see an error if I attempt to delete a player profile that has associated reports
custom_preconds:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scout user is logged in
AND user is attempting to delete a player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Delete" on a profile
custom_expected:
THEN system should check to ensure that the player does not have any Player Reports for them
AND if one or more items is found for the player, system should display an error,  Messages #35:
"You are attempting to delete a player profile that has items associated with it. Please delete any reports prior to deleting this profile."
AND user should only have "Back" button available
AND clicking back should return the user to the point of entry
AND this rule should also run when clicking Delete from the Scout clipboard 
AND if the user is deleting multiple items from their clipboard one item encountering an issue should not prevent other, unassociated items to fail

title: As a scouting user I want clicking "Add Player" on a Daily Report to check if the player already exists
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_-_responsive_layout
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches
Matching Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to create Daily Reports
AND user has navigated to a new preliminary Daily Report in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Add Player" on a Daily Report
custom_expected:
THEN system should run a standard 4 of 7 match check against all International Amateur players. (assume no limitations at this point) 
AND if a match to an existing player is found, the user should be presented with the match, or matches
AND user should have the option to add the player found to the Daily Report, using a "Add Existing Player" button
AND if the user adds an existing player to the report, any relevant fields should pre-populate on the Daily Report from the player's existing profile
AND the user should also have a "Back" button to allow them to go back and adjust the information entered and try again
AND the user should NOT have the option to add the entered information to the report if a match is found

title: As a scouting user I want to save a new Daily Report
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_-_responsive_layout
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to save Daily Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user is creating a new International Daily report
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a "Save" button as well as a "Cancel" button
AND clicking Cancel should ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes
AND if they confirm, then the creation process should be canceled, the profile should be discarded and the user should be returned to their point of entry
AND clicking "Save" should save the report as "Preliminary"
AND no required field or formatting checks are run when saving a report in preliminary

title: As a user I want to be able to search for Daily Reports
custom_preconds:
Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Search+-+Daily+Report
GIVEN a user is logged in with permission to view Daily Reports
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to advanced search
custom_expected:
THEN "International Daily Report2" should be an option 
AND this advanced search should have the filters available per the above requirements document
AND the available columns should match the above requirements document
AND export to excel and pdf should work for the results set
AND by default, only Approved reports should be shown in results UNLESS the user purposefully adds a status filter to the search to look for other statuses
NOTE: This functionality should not impact the existing "International Daily Report"  advanced search - that will be 'turned off' at a later date (after Intl go-live in 2.5)(currently only available in amateur)

title: As a scouting user I want to resubmit a new Daily Report for review
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_-_responsive_layout
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scout user is logged in with permission to submit daily reports
AND one or more scouting reports submitted by the user is in Rejected status
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to their scout clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should see any daily reports created by them on their Scout Clipboard when they are in a Rejected status
AND opening a Rejected report from the Clipboard should open the report in edit mode with a "Save" "Cancel" and "Submit" button available
AND the scout should be able to edit the report and save changes without a required field or formatting check
AND clicking "Submit" from a rejected report should save any edits made, run a business rules, required field and format check and complete the submission, just as though the report were in a Preliminary status
AND blue notification should be thrown "Successfully Submitted"
AND the report should have its status updated to Submitted, and should appear on the Admin Clipboard and Scout Clipboard as Submitted

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if attempting to submit a Daily Report that includes a player that now exists
custom_preconds:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scout is logged in with permission to submit daily reports
AND user has a new daily report open in edit mode
AND one or more players have been added to the report that do NOT yet have a profile in the system
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit"
custom_expected:
THEN system should run a match check for any players that have been added to the report that do not yet have a profile in the system
AND if any of the new players is found to now have a profile in the system, system should display an error(Messages #47):
"This report cannot be submitted because Player Name matches an existing profile. Please update this entry in the Daily Report and try again."
AND only "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should return user to the point of entry
AND this check should also be run on approve IF new players are being created on Approve

title: As a scouting user I want to be able to create a new Trainer/Agent while editing a Daily Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Scout/Scout Admin logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Daily Report in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there will be "Add New Trainer" hyperlink (See wireframe for placement).
AND Clicking "Add New Trainer" will open a new trainer/agent form in a new tab/window for the user to complete the profile. 
AND The buttons available will depend on if the user is a scout or not. 
AND Clicking "Save" or "Submit" on the new trainer/agent form will store the trainer/agent profile appropriately, just as though it were created through the normal "Create New" workflow. 
AND After the new trainer/agent has been saved - it should be prepopulated in the "Agents involved in workout" field of the Daily Report. This should not remove any trainer/agent names that have already been selected.

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_1

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Daily Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN scouting user logs in with permission to edit existing Daily Report
custom_steps: WHEN user click edit button on the Daily Report
custom_expected:
THEN Daily Report Editors (Scouts) can only edit Daily Reports in the Preliminary and Rejected statuses that they created.
AND Daily Report Approvers (Scout Admins) can edit Daily Reports in Preliminary or Rejected statuses, as well as Approved and Submitted reports.
AND No one can edit deleted reports. 
AND Editing a Rejected, Submitted or Approved report will NOT update any of the profile fields on the actual profiles of the players, even if they were automatically created as a result of submitting the profile.
AND If a player is removed from the Daily Report after initial submission, the line item should be appropriately removed from the player's scouting history - but we will not be "deleting" profiles as a result of them being removed from the Daily Report that caused them to be created.

title: As a scout I want to see an error if attempting to add a player to a Daily report that is not subject to registration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Scout user logs in 
AND opens a Daily Report
custom_steps: WHEN user enters a player info and clicks "Add Player" button on Daily report
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a match check to see if the player exists in the system. 
AND If a match is NOT found, and the date of birth entered is prior to 9/1/1995, then display an error. See Messages #50

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I only want to see Daily Reports that I have permission to see
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user with and without Daily Reports permission logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user is tries to view or edit Daily Reports
custom_expected:
THEN Users without permissions to view, edit or approve daily reports do not see these in the Scouting History at all. 
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve daily reports should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve daily reports should not be able to search for these items. 
AND All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports in the Scouting History of players and advanced search IF the record status is Approved. 
AND Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced Search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the user specifically applies the status filter. If they do apply the status filter, then they should be able to see any report in the system. 
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user. 
  - They do not need to apply additional filters to see non-approved statuses. 
  - Even if they DO apply additional status filters, they cannot see non-approved reports entered by other users. 
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports in a player's Scouting History if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user.

Business Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347726

title: As a Scouting user I want to see an error if I am attempting to submit a daily report without first submitting a trainer/agent included on the report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Scout or Scout Admin logs in with permission to create daily report
AND user selected a trainer/agent that have a status of Preliminary or Rejected status on the daily report
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" on a Daily Report without first submitting a trainer/agent included on the report
custom_expected:
THEN the system should check that all of the trainer/agents selected in the profile are not a Preliminary or Rejected profile. 
AND If any of the selected trainer/agents have a status of Preliminary or Rejected, display an error. Messages # 53

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Scout Admin I want to see an error if I am attempting to approve a daily report without first approving a trainer/agent included on the report
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scout Admin logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Approve" on a daily report without first approving a trainer/agent included on the report
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that all of the trainer/agents selected in the daily report are Approved. 
AND If any of the included trainer/agents have a status other than "Approved", display an error. Messages # 54

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a scouting user I want to Submit a new International Workout Report for review
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to Submit new International Workout Reports
custom_steps: WHEN scouting user opens a preliminary player report in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should have an Edit, Submit and Close button
AND clicking Close should close the profile
BUT when the report is in Edit Mode, user should have a Save, Submit and Cancel button
AND clicking "Save" should save any edits made to the report
AND no required field and formatting checks should be run given that the report is in a Preliminary state
AND the report's status should not update
AND clicking "Cancel" should ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any changes
AND if the user confirms, the report's status should remain preliminary and the report should reload in view mode
AND clicking "Submit" should run a required field and formatting check per the data discovery
AND once the report has passed the required field and formatting checks, if the report was in edit mode, it should be reloaded in view mode
AND the report's status should update to "Submitted"
AND the status should be reflected on the creating scout's Clipboard
AND the player report should appear for review on the scouting Admin's Clipboard

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the entered OFP is not between 20 and 80
custom_preconds:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in 
AND user has an intl workout report open in edit mode
AND user has entered an OFP Adjusted or OFP Basic value that is NOT between 20 and 80(inclusive)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should checks that the OFP Adjusted and Basic entered is a value between 40 and 80 (inclusive)
AND if not, system should display an error, Messages #45:
"The following fields contain invalid data: 1. Field Name - Value must be between 20 and 80."
AND only Back button should be available
AND clicking back should return user to entry point

title: As a Scout Admin I want to see an error if I am attempting to approve a player report without first approving a trainer/agent included on the report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Scout admin logs in
AND a trainer/agent profile is not approved yet
custom_steps: WHEN user Approves a player report with the trainer/agents who is not approved yet
custom_expected:
THEN system should display an error. Messages #54

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Scouting user I want to see an error if I am attempting to submit a player report without first submitting a trainer/agent included on the report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Scout or Scout admin logs in
AND a trainer/agent profile is in Preliminary or Rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user Submits a player report with the trainer/agents who is in Preliminary or Rejected state
custom_expected:
THEN system will display an error. Messages #53

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Scout I want to submit items from my Clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout user is logged in with permissions for Scout Clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN scout user navigates to Scout Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to check off multiple items and hit "Submit"
AND the system should process them in the following order: 
 - Trainer/Agent Profiles
 - Player Profiles
 - Reports
AND this should allow all items to go through, assuming that none of the individual items encounter an issue 
BUT if the first item in a group fails, they should all fail:
  - Ex: If a player profile is reliant upon a trainer/agent submission and a player report is reliant upon the player submission, all three would fail. 
AND one item encountering an issue should not prevent other, unassociated items to fail: 
 - Ex: If a player profile fails, any player reports that are NOT for that player should still succeed.

title: As a scout I want to delete an item from my Clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout user is logged in with permissions for the Scout Clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN scout user navigates to their Scout Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to select any Preliminary or Rejected item from their Clipboard
AND user should be able to select multiple items at once
AND clicking "Delete" should update each item's status to Deleted
AND the Scout should see a blue confirmation message stating how many items were Deleted (X items deleted)
AND the Deleted items should no longer appear on the Clipboard

*Note that eventually there will be rule checks around what can be deleted, but for now assume that everything that can be selected can be deleted.*

title: As a scout I want to see an error if I attempt to delete a Submitted item from my Clipboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Scout user logs in
AND has submitted items on the Clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to delete submitted items on their clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN the system should display an error. See Messages #52. 
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Scout Admin I want to be able to approve items from my Clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout admin user is logged in with permissions for the Scout Admin Clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN scout admin user navigates to Scout Admin Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to check off multiple items and hit "Approve"
AND the system should process them in the order that they were submitted, based on date AND time stamp to ensure proper sequencing
AND this should allow all items to go through, assuming that none of the individual items encounter an issue
AND one item encountering an issue should not prevent other, unassociated items to fail:
 - Ex: If a player profile fails, any player reports that are NOT for that player should still succeed

title: As a Scout Admin I want to be able to reject items from my Clipboard
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=approve_rejecting_items
GIVEN a scout admin user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to their Scout Admin Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to check off multiple items and hit "Reject"
AND the system should process them in the following order: 
 - Trainer/Agent Profiles
 - Player Profiles
 - Reports
AND this should allow all items to go through, assuming that none of the individual items encounter an issue
AND one item encountering an issue should not prevent other, unassociated items to fail
 - Ex: If a player profile fails, any player reports that are NOT for that player should still succeed. 
AND if all items are Rejected successfully system should throw a blue notification "X items successfully Rejected"
BUT if 1 or more items fail system should show a results modal

title: As a scouting user I want any items approved to drop off my clipboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Scouting Admin logs in 
AND Scouting admin clipboard has Unregistered Player, Player Report, Daily Report , or Trainer/Agent item(s)
custom_steps: WHEN user Approves the item(s)
custom_expected: THEN the approved item or items will drop off the creating scouts clipboard

title: As a Scout Admin I want to Approve a new Trainer/Agent profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting Admin logs in with scouting and trainer/agent edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing their Admin Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN Scouting admin should see any trainer/agent profile with a Submitted status
AND Opening the submitted trainer/agent profile from the Clipboard should open the item in Edit Mode.
AND There should be Save, Approve, Reject and Cancel buttons available.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the profile is reloaded in view mode and no changes are saved.
AND Clicking "Save" will save any edits made to the profile. All required field and formatting checks should be run given that the profile is in a Submitted state. The profile's status will not update.
AND Clicking "Approve" will save any edits made to the profile. All required field and formatting checks should be run. Once the field checks pass, the form should be reloaded in View Mode, and the profile's status should be updated to "Approved". 
AND The trainer/agent entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard as well as the submitting Scout's Clipboard.

title: As a scouting user I do not want to see the International dashboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user is view the left nav
custom_expected:
THEN Users who are only identified as scouts will not see the International dashboard on left nav 
AND The trainer/agents tab will display on the Scouting dashboard

title: As a user I want to see the Scouting dashboard if I have the appropriate permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN user with permission to see at least one of the Scouting dashboard tabs logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to access Scouting Dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN only those users with permission to see at least one of the Scouting dashboard tabs should now be able to see the "Scouting" left navigation option. (Note that it's possible not all of these users will have the new INTL User LDAP so this should no longer be used)
AND the default landing tab if available should be the Clipboard tab
AND the tabs available to users should appear in alphabetical order in the left navigation
AND only those users with either the Scouting Admin Clipboard or Scout Clipboard permission should see the Clipboard tab under Scouting
AND Only those users with the Domestic Video Log or International Video Log widget permission should see the Video Log tab under Scouting(NOT IMPLEMENTED FOR INTL GO LIVE)
AND only those users with Unregistered Players editors or approvers OR international player report editors or approvers OR daily report editors or approvers should see the Create New tab under Scouting

title: As a user I no longer want to see the "International Amateur" dashboard that redirects to amateur
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user logged in with permission to view one of the International dashboard tabs
custom_steps: WHEN user login to ebis
custom_expected:
THEN user should now be able to see the "International" left navigation option. (Note that it's possible not all of these users will have the new INTL User LDAP so this should no longer be used). 
AND Only those users with the Winter League Request viewers or editors permission should see the WLP - Requests tab under International.
AND Only those users with the Winter League Reserve List widget viewers permission should see the WLP - Reserve List tab under International. 
AND Only those users with the Winter League Club Communication widget viewers permission should see the WLP - Club Comms tab under International. 
AND The existing "International" left navigation is updated so that the "International Amateur" tab that links to amateur is no longer visible to any users. 
AND Only those users with International Amateur editors permission see the New Player tab.
AND Only those users with the Club Registration List or the Registration Admin permission see the L1 Reg tab.
AND Only those users with the L2 Widget viewers permission see the L2 tab.
AND Only those users with either of the L2 Inquiries widget permissions see the L2 Inquiries tab. 
AND Only those users with the External Registration form permission see the External Reg tab.

title: As a user I only want to see the "new" International Amateur Quick Search
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user logged in with quick search permissions for International Amateur Player
And user wants to find an International Amateur Player quickly
custom_steps: WHEN user click on the arrow to select the options from quick search dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN The existing "International Amateur Players" quick search is removed.
AND The "International Amateur Players2" quick search is renamed just "International Amateur"

title: As a user I only want to see the "new" International Amateur Advanced Searches
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user logged in with Advance Search permissions for International Amateur Player
AND user is on the advance search page
custom_steps: WHEN user click on the dropdown arrow in advanced search
custom_expected:
THEN The existing "International Amateur Player" advanced search is removed completely.
AND The "International Amateur Player2" advanced search is renamed just "International Amateur Player". 
AND The "International Trainer2" advanced search is renamed "International Trainer". (the other search should only have been in amateur so this should not need to be removed - but if it does need to be then please remove it)
AND The existing "International Player Report" advanced search is removed completely. 
AND The "International Player Report2" advanced search is renamed just "International Player Report".

title: As a Club user I only want to see players that I have permission to see in Advanced Search (updated)
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user logs in with International Amateur players permission
custom_steps: WHEN user runs an advanced search for International Amateur players as a Club
custom_expected:
THEN system should follow the new visibility rules. 
 - Unregistered profiles are NEVER returned as a result for Club users, regardless of status or if they are an International Prospect or International Suspect.  
 - Players identified as Group 1 or Group 2 players are not automatically visible anymore. 
AND The remainder of the visibility restrictions remain in place and should continue to work. 
AND The "Scouting Status" filter should also be removed from Advanced Search for Club users.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a Club user I only want to see players that I have permission to see in Quick Search (updated)
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user logs in with International Amateur players permission
custom_steps: WHEN user runs a quick search for International Amateur players as a Club
custom_expected:
THEN system should follow the new visibility rules.  
 - Unregistered profiles are NEVER returned as a result for Club users, regardless of status or if they are an International Prospect or International Suspect.  
 - Players identified as Group 1 or Group 2 players are not automatically visible anymore. 
AND The remainder of the visibility restrictions remain in place and should continue to work.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a BOC User I only want to see players that I have permission to see in Advanced Search
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user logs in with permission to view/edit/approve International player profiles in Advanced Search
custom_steps: WHEN user is using Advanced search to find an International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player profiles should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player profiles should not be able to search for these items. 
AND All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these profiles should see these in advanced search IF the record status is Approved. 
AND Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these profiles should see these returned in Advanced Search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the user specifically applies the status filter. If they do apply the status filter, then they should be able to see any profile in the system.
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these profiles should see these returned in Advanced search if they have a status of Submitted, regarldess of who created the profile.
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these profiles should see these returned in Advanced search if they have a status other than Approved or Submitted ONLY IF the creating user of the profile matches the current user. 
AND They do not need to apply additional filters to see non-approved statuses. 
AND Even if they DO apply additional status filters, they cannot see non-approved profiles entered by other users.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a BOC User I only want to see players that I have permission to see in Quick Search
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user logs in with permissions to view/edit/approve International player profiles in Quick Search
custom_steps: WHEN user is using quick search to find an International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player profiles should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player profiles should not be able to search for these items. 
AND All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these profiles should see these in advanced search IF the record status is Approved. 
AND Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these profiles should only see Approved records in quick search OR non-approved records created by the viewing user.
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these profiles should see all Submitted and Approved profiles returned, regardless of who created the profile.
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these profiles should see Preliminary and Rejected profiles returned ONLY IF the creating user of the profile matches the current user. 
AND All of these quick search rules should also apply to the "Create New" menu for International Player reports

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a developer, I want to remove all instance of EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW from the code base
custom_preconds: GIVEN the LDAP EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW has been removed as a reference from all EBIS code (UI and Services tier)
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in with an account that does NOT have EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW LDAP
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to do anything with international profiles, reports etc that they have permission to do
Example:
user without EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW but with EBIS-INTL-PLAYER-VIEWERS should still be able to view intl profiles

title: As a user I only want to be able to see Club - selected L2 information if I have permission to do so
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Scouting user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a player profile for player that was selected for L2 Registration by a Club
custom_expected:
THEN the L2 Date should NOT populate on the player profile
AND This should continue to display "No" for these users.

title: As a user I only want to see Trainer/agent profiles that I have permission to see
custom_preconds: GIVEN user with and without permission to view Trainer/agent profiles logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user tries to view Trainer/agent profiles
custom_expected:
THEN Users without permissions to view, edit or approve trainer/agent profiles should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve trainer/agent profiles should not be able to search for these items. 
AND Trainer/Agent profiles should ONLY appear in the Trainer/Agent widget if they are Approved. 
AND All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these profiles should see these in advanced search IF the record status is Approved. 
AND Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these profiles should see these returned in Advanced Search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the user specifically applies the status filter. If they do apply the status filter, then they should be able to see any profile in the system. 
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these profiles should see these returned in Advanced search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user. 
  - They do not need to apply additional filters to see non-approved statuses. 
  - Even if they DO apply additional status filters, they cannot see non-approved profiles entered by other users. 
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these profiles should see non-approved profiles as an option in any trainer/agent field if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the trainer/agent matches the current user. 
AND Users that are not identified as Scouts should not see non-approved profiles as an option in any trainer/agent field in the system. 
AND Users that are not identified as Scouts SHOULD see non-approved profiles as a value if viewing an item created by a Scout. (Ex: If an admin opens a Player Report and it includes submitted profiles, those should continue to display as values - but they would not be able to add them to the report).

title: As a user I only want to see those International Player Reports that I have permission to see
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user with and without International Player Reports permission logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user is tries to view or edit International Player Reports
custom_expected:
THEN Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports do not see these in the Scouting History at all. 
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.
AND Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports should not be able to search for these items. 
AND All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports in the Scouting History of players and advanced search IF the record status is Approved. 
AND Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced Search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the user specifically applies the status filter. If they do apply the status filter, then they should be able to see any report in the system. 
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user. 
  - They do not need to apply additional filters to see non-approved statuses. 
  - Even if they DO apply additional status filters, they cannot see non-approved reports entered by other users. 
AND Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports in a player's Scouting History if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user.

Business Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347726

title: As a Club user I want to see a warning if I am attempting to enter a new player profile that matches another profile (updated)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Club user logs in with permission to creating a new International Amateur profile
custom_steps: WHEN user Clicks "Next" on the Create New when creating a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to another international player profile that the user has permission to see as a match, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or #5.
AND MLSB Group 1 or Group 2 profiles are no longer automatically public. 
AND International Suspects should NOT appear as matches to Club users.
AND Unregistered International Prospects should ONLY appear as a match to Club users if they have a record status of Approved.
AND The remainder of the visibility restrictions should continue to work.
AND Register MLSB Entered and Add to Club Reg list functionality should continue to work as previously laid out.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a BOC user I want to see a warning if I am attempting to enter a new player profile that matches another profile (updated)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user logs in with permission to create new International Amateur profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Next" on the Create New when creating a new International Amateur profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules (NOT via the Scouting dashboard). 
AND If a match is found to another international player profile, including to an International Suspect profile, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or #5.
AND International Suspects SHOULD appear as matches to BOC users. They should have the option to Register MLSB entered for these profiles, just like any other Unregistered profile. 
AND Unregistered International Prospects should ONLY appear as a match to BOC users if they have a record status of Approved UNLESS the BOC user also has the ability to create unregistered profiles. If they have that permission, then they also see matches to Submitted profiles.
AND Register MLSB Entered and Add to Club Reg list functionality should continue to work as previously laid out.

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur
